intro: Melhania oblongifolia f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf melhania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The subspecies angustifolia is distinguished by its narrower foliage compared to the typical form of Melhania oblongifolia.
